```{r}
library(ggplot2)
```

# Unbalanced Dataset
```{r}
unbalanced <- data.frame(housing = c("no housing insecure", "housing insecure"),
                sample = c(46182, 2118))

p1 <- ggplot(data = unbalanced, aes(x = housing, y = sample)) + geom_bar(stat = "identity", width = 0.4, fill = "steelblue") +
  geom_text(aes(label = sample), vjust = 1.2, color = "white", size = 3.5) + theme_minimal()
p1

text <- element_text(face = "bold", color = "steelblue")

p1 <- p1 + labs(title = "Unbalanced Data Sample", x = "Housing Insecurity Type", y = "Sample") +
  theme(title = element_text(hjust = 0.5), plot.title = text, axis.title = text)
p1
```

# Over Sampling Dataset
```{r}
unbalanced <- data.frame(housing = c("no housing insecure", "housing insecure"),
                sample = c(32328, 32248))

p2 <- ggplot(data = unbalanced, aes(x = housing, y = sample)) + geom_bar(stat = "identity", width = 0.4, fill = "steelblue") + geom_text(aes(label = sample), vjust = 1.6, color = "white", size = 3.5) + theme_minimal()

text <- element_text(face = "bold", color = "steelblue")

p2 <- p2 + labs(title = "Over Sampling Data Sample", x = "Housing Insecurity Type", y = "Sample") + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5)) + theme(plot.title = text, axis.title = text)
p2
```
